explanation: suddenly filled with strong feelings of shock and worry
sentence: He stood aghast at the sight of so much blood.
sentence_gap: He stood ______ at the sight of so much blood.

explanation: formal; a thing or an event that exists or comes before another, and may have influenced it
sentence: The book dealt with the historical antecedents of the Civil War.
sentence_gap: The book dealt with the historical ___________ of the Civil War.

explanation: an extremely cruel, violent, or shocking act
sentence: They are on trial for committing atrocities against the civilian population.
sentence_gap: They are on trial for committing __________ against the civilian population.

explanation: formal; to increase the size or value of something by adding something to it
sentence: He would have to find work to augment his income.
sentence_gap: He would have to find work to _______ his income.

explanation: use, purpose, advantage, or profit
sentence: We tried to persuade her not to resign, but to no avail.
sentence_gap: We tried to persuade her not to resign, but to no _____.

explanation: a painful swelling on the skin that contains liquid, caused usually by continuous rubbing, especially on your foot, or by burning
sentence: New shoes always give me blisters.
sentence_gap: New shoes always give me ________.

explanation: literary or humorous; to enjoy yourself by drinking alcohol and speaking and laughing loudly in a group of people
sentence: We'd been up carousing till the early hours and were exhausted.
sentence_gap: We'd been up _________ till the early hours and were exhausted.

explanation: formal; a feeling of being certain; a thing about which you are certain
sentence: It is impossible to predict the outcome of the negotiations with any degree of certitude.
sentence_gap: It is impossible to predict the outcome of the negotiations with any degree of _________.

explanation: (of people and animals) moving or doing things in a very awkward way
sentence: I spilled your coffee. Sorry—that was clumsy of me.
sentence_gap: I spilled your coffee. Sorry—that was ______ of me.

explanation: formal; (of a person) pleasant to spend time with because their interests and character are similar to your own
sentence: We spent a relaxed evening with congenial friends.
sentence_gap: We spent a relaxed evening with _________ friends.

explanation: formal disapproving; wanting to have something too much, especially something that belongs to someone else
sentence: I can't help casting covetous looks at my neighbour's new Porsche.
sentence_gap: I can't help casting ________ looks at my neighbour's new Porsche.

explanation: fear or lack of courage
sentence: The lieutenant had displayed cowardice in the face of the enemy.
sentence_gap: The lieutenant had displayed _________ in the face of the enemy.

explanation: simple and not very accurate but giving a general idea of something; simple and not skilfully done or made
sentence: In crude terms, the causes of mental illness seem to be of three main kinds.
sentence_gap: In _____ terms, the causes of mental illness seem to be of three main kinds.

explanation: slightly wet, especially in a way that is not pleasant or comfortable
sentence: This shirt still feels a bit damp.
sentence_gap: This shirt still feels a bit ____.

explanation: to do something or go somewhere very slowly, taking more time than is necessary
sentence: Stop dawdling! We're going to be late!
sentence_gap: Stop ________! We're going to be late!

explanation: a god or goddess
sentence: Ares and Aphrodite were the ancient Greek deities of war and love.
sentence_gap: Ares and Aphrodite were the ancient Greek _______ of war and love.

explanation: a very large amount of rain or water
sentence: This little stream can become a deluge when it rains heavily.
sentence_gap: This little stream can become a ______ when it rains heavily.

explanation: formal; the situation in which someone or something is laughed at and considered stupid or of no value
sentence: They treated his suggestion with derision.
sentence_gap: They treated his suggestion with ________.

explanation: to invent a plan, system, object, etc., usually using your intelligence or imagination
sentence: He's good at devising language games that you can play with students in class.
sentence_gap: He's good at ________ language games that you can play with students in class.

explanation: controlled, serious, and calm, and therefore deserving respect
sentence: He has maintained a dignified silence about the rumours.
sentence_gap: He has maintained a _________ silence about the rumours.

explanation: the feeling that you do not like or approve of someone or something
sentence: They looked upon the birth of a girl with disfavor.
sentence_gap: They looked upon the birth of a girl with ________.

explanation: formal; an official order, especially one that is given in a forceful and unfair way
sentence: The City Council issued an edict against spitting in the street.
sentence_gap: The City Council issued an _____ against spitting in the street.

explanation: to make someone very annoyed, usually when they can do nothing to solve a problem
sentence: His assistant’s carelessness is exasperating him.
sentence_gap: His assistant’s carelessness is ____________ him.

explanation: (an act or example of) escape, running away, or avoiding something
sentence: They lost all their possessions during their flight from the invading army.
sentence_gap: They lost all their possessions during their ______ from the invading army.

explanation: not serious about a serious subject, in an attempt to be funny or to appear clever
sentence: It's easy to be flippant, but we have a serious problem to deal with here.
sentence_gap: It's easy to be ________, but we have a serious problem to deal with here.

explanation: a group of sheep, goats, or birds
sentence: The shepherd is bringing his flock down from the hills.
sentence_gap: The shepherd is bringing his _____ down from the hills.

explanation: the finger next to the thumb
sentence: He held a tiny seed between his thumb and forefinger.
sentence_gap: He held a tiny seed between his thumb and __________.

explanation: formal; starting from this time
sentence: Henceforth, the said building shall be the property of Brendan Duggan.
sentence_gap: __________, the said building shall be the property of Brendan Duggan.

explanation: formal; used to describe (someone who has) strong opinions or feelings that are impossible to change
sentence: Even after being offered a free gift card, the angry customer remained implacable.
sentence_gap: Even after being offered a free gift card, the angry customer remained __________.

explanation: to encourage someone to behave in a particular way by offering them a reward
sentence: You need to incentivize your existing customers to stay with you.
sentence_gap: You need to ___________ your existing customers to stay with you.

explanation: too many to be counted
sentence: The project has been delayed by innumerable problems.
sentence_gap: The project has been delayed by ___________ problems.

explanation: formal; to the degree that
sentence: She had done her best to comfort him, insofar as she was able.
sentence_gap: She had done her best to comfort him, _______ as she was able.

explanation: to cover something with a special material so that heat, electricity, or sound cannot escape through it
sentence: Some parents want to insulate their children from real life.
sentence_gap: Some parents want to ________ their children from real life.

explanation: impossible to defeat or prevent from doing what is intended
sentence: Last year the company seemed invincible but in recent weeks has begun to have problems.
sentence_gap: Last year the company seemed __________ but in recent weeks has begun to have problems.

explanation: a white substance made from pig fat and used in cooking
sentence: We cannot get enough lard to replace compound cooking fat entirely.
sentence_gap: We cannot get enough ____ to replace compound cooking fat entirely.

explanation: the punishment of being hit with a whip
sentence: He was sentenced to receive a lashing.
sentence_gap: He was sentenced to receive a _______.

explanation: clearly expressed and easily understood; literary; clear and transparent
sentence: His prose style is flexible, limpid, and a great pleasure to read.
sentence_gap: His prose style is flexible, ______, and a great pleasure to read.

explanation: formal; living for a long time
sentence: To what do you attribute your longevity?
sentence_gap: To what do you attribute your _________?

explanation: informal; a young man who behaves in a very rude, offensive, and sometimes violent way
sentence: Teenage louts roam the streets at night.
sentence_gap: Teenage _____ roam the streets at night.

explanation: an animal or plant that lives on or in another animal or plant of a different type and feeds from it
sentence: The older drugs didn't deal effectively with the malaria parasite.
sentence_gap: The older drugs didn't deal effectively with the malaria ________.

explanation: (especially in the past, or in poorer countries) a farmer who owns or rents a small piece of land
sentence: Tons of internationally donated food was distributed to the starving peasants.
sentence_gap: Tons of internationally donated food was distributed to the starving ________.

explanation: formal; to spread through something and be present in every part of it
sentence: A foul smell of stale beer permeated the whole building.
sentence_gap: A foul smell of stale beer _________ the whole building.

explanation: to spread through and be noticeable in every part of something
sentence: The film movie is a reflection of the violence that pervades our culture.
sentence_gap: The film movie is a reflection of the violence that ________ our culture.

explanation: an enclosed area where pigs are kept; a dirty or messy place
sentence: Your bedroom's a pigsty!
sentence_gap: Your bedroom's a ______!

explanation: law; someone who makes a legal complaint against someone else in court
sentence: The court upheld the plaintiff's claim for damages.
sentence_gap: The court upheld the _________'s claim for damages.

explanation: a serious or formal promise, especially one to give money or to be a friend, or something that you give as a sign that you will keep a promise
sentence: All the candidates have given pledges not to raise taxes if they are elected.
sentence_gap: All the candidates have given _______ not to raise taxes if they are elected.

explanation: the ordinary people who live in a particular country or place
sentence: Some studies show that workers in the nuclear industry are more likely than the general populace to get cancer.
sentence_gap: Some studies show that workers in the nuclear industry are more likely than the general ________ to get cancer.

explanation: an idea or theory on which a statement or action is based
sentence: They had started with the premise that all men are created equal.
sentence_gap: They had started with the _______ that all men are created equal.

explanation: too confident, in a way that shows a lack of respect for other people
sentence: It would be presumptuous of me to comment on the matter.
sentence_gap: It would be ____________ of me to comment on the matter.

explanation: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
sentence: His mother's death when he was aged six had a very profound effect on him.
sentence_gap: His mother's death when he was aged six had a very ________ effect on him.

explanation: a position in an organization, such as the army, showing the importance of the person having it
sentence: He has just been promoted to the rank of captain.
sentence_gap: He has just been promoted to the ____ of captain.

explanation: a particular way of performing a song, piece of music, or poem
sentence: The band gave a live rendition of their latest single.
sentence_gap: The band gave a live _________ of their latest single.

explanation: to go back over something, for example a path or a series of past actions
sentence: When he realized he had lost his keys, he retraced in his mind his movements that day.
sentence_gap: When he realized he had lost his keys, he ________ in his mind his movements that day.

explanation: to move or travel around an area, especially a large one
sentence: He spent most of his life roving the world in search of his fortune.
sentence_gap: He spent most of his life ______ the world in search of his fortune.

explanation: avoiding excitement or great activity and usually calm and relaxed
sentence: The fight against a chemical storage site has transformed a normally sedate village into a battleground.
sentence_gap: The fight against a chemical storage site has transformed a normally ______ village into a battleground.

explanation: literary; sleep; a time when someone is asleep
sentence: The phone suddenly roused her from slumber.
sentence_gap: The phone suddenly roused her from _______.

explanation: (of a person) not happy or smiling
sentence: Her face grew solemn.
sentence_gap: Her face grew ______.

explanation: informal; extremely wet
sentence: You're sopping wet - go and get changed.
sentence_gap: You're _______ wet - go and get changed.

explanation: to speak quickly and with difficulty, making soft spitting sounds, because you are angry or embarrassed
sentence: He sputtered an apology about being 14 minutes late.
sentence_gap: He _________ an apology about being 14 minutes late.

explanation: medical; existing under the skin
sentence: Subcutaneous tissue has few blood vessels and so drugs injected here are for slow, sustained rates of absorption.
sentence_gap: ____________ tissue has few blood vessels and so drugs injected here are for slow, sustained rates of absorption.

explanation: a deep hole dug by soldiers and used as a place from which they can attack the enemy while being hidden; a narrow hole that is dug into the ground
sentence: A workman was killed when the sides of the trench he was working in collapsed.
sentence_gap: A workman was killed when the sides of the ______ he was working in collapsed.

explanation: a fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs, that is a popular food
sentence: The lake is famous for its trout fishing.
sentence_gap: The lake is famous for its _____ fishing.

explanation: a sudden short feeling of physical or mental pain
sentence: I admit I felt a twinge of guilt as we left. I felt a twinge in my knee.
sentence_gap: I admit I felt a ______ of guilt as we left. I felt a ______ in my knee.

explanation: strange or mysterious; difficult or impossible to explain
sentence: He has an uncanny ability to pick a winner.
sentence_gap: He has an _______ ability to pick a winner.

explanation: to push or move something so that the part that usually touches the ground is not touching the ground any more
sentence: She upended the chessboard halfway through the game because she was losing.
sentence_gap: She _______ the chessboard halfway through the game because she was losing.

explanation: formal; (of a sin or mistake) not very serious and therefore able to be forgiven
sentence: A venial sin, for you acted without evil intention.
sentence_gap: A ______ sin, for you acted without evil intention.

explanation: formal; changes that happen at different times during the life or development of someone or something, especially those that result in conditions being worse
sentence: Losing your job is just one of the vicissitudes of life.
sentence_gap: Losing your job is just one of the ____________ of life.

explanation: a thick pile of pieces of paper, paper money, etc. folded or rolled together
sentence: He pulled a thick wad of $20 bills out of his pocket.
sentence_gap: He pulled a thick ___ of $20 bills out of his pocket.

explanation: useful, important, or good enough to be a suitable reward for the money or time spent or the effort made
sentence: She considers teaching a worthwhile career.
sentence_gap: She considers teaching a __________ career.

explanation: literary; extreme anger
sentence: The people feared the wrath of God.
sentence_gap: The people feared the _____ of God.
